timeline.bodyText: Is there a possibility to remove the Check for Oracle and MSSQL server check below? As per the comment The name of the database is being checked because there is no way to identify through the API. it seems it was done without knowing the Connection.getMetaData().supportsGetGeneratedKeys() API method.
timeline.author: anupama-pathirage

replies.bodyText: No. "supportsGetGeneratedKeys" - function if true guarantees at least insert operation is supported. Others are vendor-specific. Oracle official driver returns true for this API but Oracle does not support key retrieval in the batch operations.
replies.author: KRVPerera

timeline.message:
Get generated keys JDBC only if supported

Getting generated keys from JDBC driver only if supported by JDBC
driver. This prevent exceptions for create/update queries issued
againsed HANA DB like databases where JDBC driver does not
support returning generated keys

Signed-off-by: KRVPerera <rukshan.viduranga@gmail.com>
